Text.Value: I'd like to visit the prison. Where is it?
You fabulous murderer. Oh, I wish I could have seen him grovel and beg and bleed. Maybe his soul will come to us one day.
She pops in and out of existence all over the House, but whatever you've seen is just a trick of the light.
Any idea where I can find her?
The greatest pest of all! I've always thought Hope to be a dirty, empty little word. She suits it well.

EditorData.NodeContext: Annoyed to hear mention of Hope 'the greatest pest of all'. He hates her, but more like you might hate a mosquito that is buzzing around than a nemesis

Text.Value: I made a mistake. Raphael doesn't tolerate mistakes.

EditorData.NodeContext: a little bitter, reminiscing on a mistake

Text.Value: We had one houseguest by the name of Gortash, a mischievous little blot of a boy, and he slipped through my fingers.
You're a curious little bug.
Strange that they need directions. There's only one way into the prison - down the hatch at the end of the corridor on the left.

EditorData.NodeContext: inner thoughts - pondering, giving clear directions

Text.Value: Probe the target's mind.
Make your way ot the balcony next door, and you can find your way inside. Just make sure not to fall. It's a long way down.

EditorData.NodeContext: final warning delivered with a hint of amusement

Text.Value: Now, I guard the portals to ensure that no undesirable people enter.

EditorData.NodeContext: emphasis on 'undesirable' to contrast with desirable in previous line

Text.Value: You missed your chance. Let's talk about something else.
I'd like to see the prison that held the former Lord Gortash. Where is it?
Gortash is dead, by my hand.
All right, all right. Turn left when you exit this chamber, and you will find a hatch that leads beneath the House. That's where we keep the naughtiest souls.

EditorData.NodeContext: short-tempered on 'alright, alright', then giving clear directions

Text.Value: What are you doing here?
I've had enough pests bothering me today, I don't need another.
Leave.
No interest at all, actually.
Leave.
Stay out of my way, don't touch anything, and keep quiet.
Yes?
He was the son of a cobbler or somesuch meagre tradesman, sold to Raphael by his loving parents to pay off a petty debt.
What interest do you have in the prison?

EditorData.NodeContext: suspicious, slight emphasis on 'you' - he's wondering why a stranger would want to see the prison

Text.Value: Just tell me where it is before I rip out whatever's left of your soul.
Such a splendid deed deserves a splendid reward, and there's no better reward in the hells than the pleasures and pains of the flesh.
It's most irksome.
You'll be pleased to hear I killed him.
We all must have our hobbies, I suppose.
Do watch out for the guards though. They're not as reasonable as you and I.

EditorData.NodeContext: a warning, but delivered with a smile - it amuses him to tell us of the danger awaiting us

Text.Value: You're already tormenting me with all of these questions. I've had quite enough of answering them, thank you very much.
I'd like to escort the killer of Gortash there myself,  but I cannot leave my post.
But her appearances are just a trick of the light.
Turn left when you exit this chamber, and clamber down the hatch that leads beneath the House.
How did Gortash end up here in the House of Hope?
Who is she?
I used to work in the prison, ensuring no desirable people left the House of Hope.
Away with you. The portals are closed.
What is this place?
Why don't you work in the prison anymore?
Do you know Hope?
I'd like to snap his neck myself.
You're not allowed to do that! Nobody but Raphael can see my thoughts!
With any luck, the guards will swallow you whole, you repugnant little scrap.
The Chamber of Egress - way station of the hells, providing access to Raphael's clientele wherever they might make their home.

EditorData.NodeContext: explaining the function of the room he's guarding, quite self-important

Text.Value: There are few sensations that can't be indulged in Raphael's boudoir. I'm not permitted to enter, but I know a secret way inside.

EditorData.NodeContext: a little but secretive, but not whispering

Text.Value: Then why not get to the snapping of necks instead of the flapping of lips. I tire of you.
She has a rather loathsome habit of popping into existence all over the house to shout words of encouragement to the other denizens.
I'd like to spend some time tormenting the inmates.
Lord? Is that what he calls himself these days? The snivelling little shit.
I'm trying to track her down, but she keeps flickering away.
Hmph.
A nasty little optimist, who doesn't have the good sense to lose her mind completely like the rest of us.
Her corporeal form is down in the dark, bound by unbreakable chains in Raphael's dungeon.
Lord indeed. I used to bruise my knuckles on his whimpering little face. I'd like to have snapped his neck!

EditorData.NodeContext: first two words he's reflecting on how preposterous the concept of Gortash being a 'lord' is. Then building anger

Text.Value: Gortash was here? Lord Enver Gortash?
It used to be my prison - Nubaldin's very own pit of pain - I was its keeper. But that was a very long time ago.

EditorData.NodeContext: annoyed, reminiscing on a post he used to hold that has been taken from him

Text.Value: I am its keeper, Nubaldin. Very much not at your service.

Synopsis: A dialogue with Nubaldin, overseer in House of Hope, that ordered Gortash around during his time of being enslaved
